newsitem.title: USA: Oakland, Calif., Coliseum board dissolves itself.
newsitem.headline: Oakland, Calif., Coliseum board dissolves itself.

text.p: The Oakland-Alameda County, Calif., Coliseum board, which has operated the sports complex for over 30 years, has voted to dissolve itself and turn over its authority to the city and county.
A reconfigured joint powers authority of the city and county was expected to take control of the coliseum's management and operations on January 1, board officials said.

The shakeup should give elected officials more control over coliseum business and the controversial $200 million deal that brought the Raiders football team back to Oakland and paid for coliseum improvements with bond proceeds.

The bonds are intended to be repaid with revenues from personal seat licenses. But sales of these licenses have fallen below projections and local officials fear they may soon have to use public funds to repay bondholders.
The Oakland City Council and the Alameda County Board of Supervisors were expected later Tuesday to review the management overhaul.
